roles.name: Power Plant Operator
roles.description: Oversees daily operations of power generation facilities (fossil fuel, nuclear, or renewables), maintaining output and equipment safety.

meta.typicalBackground: Technical training in mechanical/electrical systems, strong safety culture

sampleUseCase.scenario: A plant operator spots an abnormal turbine vibration reading via SCADA. They isolate the unit for inspection, preventing a major breakdown and ensuring grid stability.

roles.name: Renewable Energy Engineer
roles.description: Designs and deploys clean energy systems (solar, wind, hydro) to optimize resource use and reduce carbon footprints.

meta.typicalBackground: Engineering degree in electrical/mechanical/renewable energy, project management skills

sampleUseCase.scenario: A renewable energy engineer uses wind data mapping to determine optimal turbine placement, increasing annual energy production by 15% while minimizing environmental impact.

roles.name: Grid Systems Analyst
roles.description: Monitors electricity transmission and distribution networks, balancing supply, demand, and system reliability.

meta.typicalBackground: Background in electrical engineering or energy systems, adept at real-time analytics

sampleUseCase.scenario: The analyst notices a steep load increase on a hot afternoon. They schedule additional generation dispatch and implement demand response signals to large consumers, preventing brownouts.

roles.name: Energy Trader
roles.description: Buys and sells electricity, gas, or environmental credits on wholesale markets, optimizing profits and ensuring adequate supply.

meta.typicalBackground: Finance/engineering background, strong quantitative and market analysis skills

sampleUseCase.scenario: An energy trader monitors short-term weather forecasts predicting high wind output. They purchase cheaper wind-based contracts ahead of time, securing a profitable margin when the supply surges.

roles.name: Energy Efficiency Consultant
roles.description: Advises businesses and households on reducing energy consumption via audits, retrofits, and behavioral changes.

meta.typicalBackground: Engineering or sustainability degree, audit certifications (e.g., CEM), strong client-facing skills

sampleUseCase.scenario: A consultant performs an energy audit at a manufacturing plant, recommending LED lighting, updated insulation, and optimized HVAC schedules. The facility cuts monthly power bills by 20% and improves worker comfort.
